Description: KEN-DEC, Inc., a company formerly engaged in the metal plating business at 1145 South Dixie Highway, Horse Cave, Kentucky, and David Lester Becker of Cave City, Kentucky, formerly the plant manager of that business, were sentenced in United States District Court, Bowling Green, Kentucky, at Louisville, for felony violations of the Clean Water Act. KEN-DEC agreed to plead guilty to the two counts of the felony Information filed on January 11, 2010 and pay a fine of $700,000 on the date of sentencing.

Info Source: Contained in data received from the agency on October 23, 2020 in response to an open records request.
